alert.note: Alert for Sheep Range; Spring Mountains-Red Rock Canyon (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 20 at 12:07AM PST until January 23 at 10:00AM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM SATURDAY TO 10 AM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 7000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 7000 feet. For the eastern Sierra slopes, total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches at the resort level and two to three feet at the crest. For the Spring Mountains and Sheep Range, total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches between 7000 and 8000 feet and up to three feet at the mountain peaks. * WHERE...In California, Eastern Sierra Slopes. In Nevada, Sheep Range and Spring Mountains-Red Rock Canyon. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening through 10 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There will be multiple rounds of snow from Saturday through Tuesday. Snow levels will begin around 6000 feet this evening, rising to 7000 to 7500 feet by Monday morning. The heaviest and densest snow is likely to fall Monday into Tuesday morning.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous or impossible. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Sheep Range; Spring Mountains-Red Rock Canyon
